page.title: 08CASTLE HILL WIVELISCOMBE
page.content: First of all we walked through a garden of paradise and then into the wood with thick undergrowth.There were many young trees but as we got further into the wood the trees seemed to get older and taller.As we walked,trying to pick out our path,we came to a big rock face with a few small caves. Further into the woods a wider cliff face appeared but it was not so high, again there were caves (probably the homes of animals). We arrived in a clearing which had some Roman mounds ,well we thought they were,and more cliffs.Our guide told us that the Monmouth rebels used to hide in the caves 300 years ago.The cave system is said to lead to Frys Quaking House about a mile and a half away.You can get to more caves under the Quakers burial ground.
